It's typical fantasy fare with an interesting twist: you can combine any number of spells within your inventory, which made me feel very clever, even if I had no idea what I was doing.
Read more
articles.title: This roguelike made me feel like a genius (I didn't know what was happening but I was pleased with myself)

articles.author: Dayten Rose
articles.description:
Like it or not, horror gaming is often built on jump scares. Deriding a good cheap scare ignores the endorphin rush that draws so many players to the genre, in the same way that the "elevated horror" trend forfeits some of the soul of schlocky slasher flicks and ghost movies. Don’t get me wrong, Silent Hill and Alan Wake deserve their flowers - but even those games would wither on the screen if Pyramid Head didn’t bust through a wall from time to time.
One unsung jump scare game in particular pioneered horror in the internet age, blazing everywhere from nascent social media to major television networks. In fact, if you had an internet connection circa 2005, there’s a good chance you played it. Alas, it was too ahead of its time, too successful at leveraging virality before viral horror was sought after. Next time you see a streamer throw their headphones across the room in fright, beware: the spirit of Scary Maze Game is right behind you.
Read more
articles.title: You’ve probably played 2005’s most experimental horror game

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Here be your first moving-picture look at The Blood of Dawnwalker, the dark fantasy RPG in the works at Rebel Wolves – the studio founded by a bunch of former The Witcher 3 and Cyberpunk 2077 devs. As hinted at a couple of times over previous years, when it was known simply as Dawnwalker, you’ll be playing as a vampire, employing various spooky powers to fight militiamen (and, it seems, at least one giant mechanical spider-thing) amidst a deadly plague outbreak.
Unsurprisingly, in retrospect, the trailer also has big The Witcher vibes. The stringy orchestral music? The dramatic monologues? The horrible things happening to armoured grunts? This thing’s really playing the Polish fantasy hits.
Read more
articles.title: Ex-The Witcher 3 devs' vampire RPG The Blood of Dawnwalker gets a trailer, looks Witcherish

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The "spance" of Annihilate The Spance is apparently “an ancient, roiling storm of matter and energy” that harbours both “extreme and inexplicable phenomena” and “unfathomable riches”. I’m happy to discover this explanation, because at first I thought that “spance” was just a litigation-avoiding, supermarket rebrand of “space”. I was bracing to send the good news to developers Skyglow Softworks that, so far, nobody has managed to copyright “space”, though I’m sure somebody’s tried. Maybe, um, God? 


It’s a relief to know that God won’t be suing Skyglow Softworks for breach of copyright, because off the back of two demo missions, Annihilate The Spance is worryingly compelling. It’s a mixture of space RTS and autobattler, wherein you construct bases that produce spanceships who autopilot towards the nearest and largest concentration of enemies. According to the developers, it’s inspired by the 2011 Flash game Obliterate Everything by CWWallis (RIP), which I dimly recall playing while I was running a browser game blog for AOL. Anyway, here’s a trailer.
 
Read more
articles.title: I reckon you autobattler sickos will like Annihilate The Spance, probably you RTS nutters too

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Destiny creators Bungie are reportedly making a team-based MOBA that takes hefty inspiration from Nintendo's Smash Bros series. Or rather, they were. Codenamed Gummy Bears, the project is now apparently in the hands of another, newly founded PlayStation studio, with 40 Bungie developers sticking around to work on it.
 Read more
articles.title: Bungie and PlayStation are working on a MOBA inspired by Nintendo's Smash Bros, claims report

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Don't be fooled by the simple synchronicity of the headline above. We have selected our 24 favourite games from the past year every year since 2008. We reveal these beloved games across the month of December in the RPS Advent Calendar, each game behind a new door. 

This article collects all those wonderful games and our writings about them in one place, for a post-New Year reading experience that requires you to click less.

 
Read more
articles.title: Our 24 favourite games of 2024

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
In 2020's Airborne Kingdom, you cobbled together a flying city from sailcloth, smokestacks, wings and flippers, striving to meet a growing population's need for food and shelter while dealing with the more exotic problem of levelling your streets out and generating enough lift. In the process, you explored a beautiful, Orientalist world map of faded mosaic tiles and dusty gold fittings. 
In Airborne Empire, out in early access today, you do much the same again, but this time the world is trying to murder you. A bit. You are no longer alone in the skies: there are merchant dirigibles you can barter with, and pirate airships who'll strafe your suburbs and set your bazaars on fire. As such, the sequel's new city technologies include a choice of offensive and defensive weapons. Here's a launch trailer.
 Read more
articles.title: Flying city-builder Airborne Empire hits early access today with a new military element

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
MechWarrior 5: Mercenaries support studio Toadman Interactive have been shuttered by parent company Enad Global 7 as part of "cost-saving measures". This follows the studio closing down offices in Stockholm, Visby, and Oslo last November, as well as a number of redundancies at their Berlin studio. Toadman - who also developed soulslike Immortal: Unchained and provided support work for Helldivers 2   - employed 69 people at the time of closure.
 
Read more
articles.title: The future of MechWarrior looks uncertain amid Piranha Games layoffs and Toadman Interactive closure

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
EEK3 is the alternative showcase of small horror game creators that amalgamates every year like a shell of flies around the corpse of E3. It's a lot of fun for people who enjoy ye olde PS1 aesthetics and foggy throwback horror. The 2024 showcase was supposed to happen in time for Halloween, the night when the spirits of old platformer mascots rise from their graves to gift polygons to small children. But it was postponed due to technical problems. Only now has the 2-hour showcase of game trailers emerged, culminating in a new Haunted PS1 demo disc packed with upcoming games. "The curse," say the organisers, "is lifted." 
Read more
articles.title: Ahh! 72 indie horror games and a Haunted PS1 demo disc just screeched into 2025 honking the horn and apologising for being late

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I've always wished there was a game workers equivalent of gobbing in an especially rude customer's cheeseburger. Not that anyone should need the lingering threat of getting served a McLungButter to be polite to service workers, but it seems good to have the option. Possibly spurred on by reality-challenged goblins hounding Final Fantasy 7 Remake Aerith actor Brianna White, Square Enix have shared a new policy outlining how they plan to respond to harassment from customers toward their staff and partners. It's obviously a vastly more proper and legally sound approach than the aforementioned sandwich tampering, but I support it nonetheless.
Read more
articles.title: New Square Enix policy will clamp down on harassers, bigots and "unreasonable" compensation requests

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Dynasty Warriors: Origins. Finally, a game brave enough to ask: "what if everything cool that went down in Romance Of The Three Kingdoms was thanks to you, a magical, beautiful boy that no-one's ever heard of?".
It's a great premise, honestly. The slate wiped clean, what if you got to be mates with everyone from all sides in this grand ensemble tale of warring states? A battle might take eight minutes. The three consecutive bonding cutscenes before the next might take ten. Origins is just as much about fighting thousands at a time as it is about eating lunch with Zhang Fei or discussing the meaning of heroism with Zhou Yu. There's a parallel story about your character and his role in a magical order of destiny godlings I didn't find the least bit interesting, but the rest is thrilling because Romance is already thrilling. The parts that Origins bogs down with its wordier take on already wordy source material are enlivened again by anime vibrance, hijinks, and melodrama.
Read more
articles.title: Dynasty Warriors: Origins review: a glorious, melodramatic and convincing illusion of tactical warfare

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Happy mid-January all! The year is picking up pace in terms of new PC game releases, and the symptoms of the Maw's hunger are everywhere. For example, my fridge has started bleeding an iridescent fluid. Peering into the oily green depths, I see a much older, cyborg version of myself dressed in spiked leather against a background of burning oceans. The other Edwin mouths and gesticulates urgently, but I have no time for his dire warnings of global calamity. There are new entertainment products to discuss! Here's what's coming down the pipe this week.
Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! I once read in a book that you shouldn't really believe anything you read in a book until you've checked at least two other books. Unfortunately, those two books both said the same thing, meaning I had to check four more. If anyone knows what every book ever written says on the subject, do let me know. I'm trapped now. 
 Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Leverage Head of IP and former Deck 13 narrative director Christian Fonnesbech

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Welcome back to The Sunday Papers. It's 2025, which means that this column has been running for eighteen years. What might change here as we move into adulthood? Very little, I suspect. We here are like the chalk cliffs of the South Downs: bright and imposing and subject to inevitable but slow erosion by the sea. Or put another way: I'm thinking about bringing back the bulletpoints to separate different links. How are you?

Felipe Pepe wrote about the gentrification of video game history, arguing that American video game history overwrites more local experiences. "We’re not all suburban kids who got a Nintendo 64 for Christmas."

 
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Pure Rock Crawling is about steering off road vehicles across rocky terrain. It's about pumping the gas pedal and wrenching the steering wheel just so, such that you lurch forward and over the obstacles, rather than tumbling backwards. It's MudRunner without the mud, with a knockabout simplicity presumably as a result of its apparently one-man development team. It launched last October but I hadn't heard of it until today, when a new map was added, and now I want to play it.

 
Read more
articles.title: Pure Rock Crawling looks like a knockabout MudRunner without the mud

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Minecraft is the best PC game, according to me and the RPS staff who dare not cross me. I played it for three hours today and, among the many build challenges and adventures, a small story formed around a baby pig. We named him Porky, we caged him as our pet, and in an unfortunate accident, we watched as he fell to his death from the sky island that was our home. RPS in peace, Porky.

How many befriended pigs like Porky have there been across the last several hundred hours of play? I'm not sure - dozens, hundreds - but soon such pigs might have a new form. After 15 years, Mojang are adding new types of pig to Minecraft.

 
Read more
articles.title: Minecraft's beta versions now offer adorable hot and cold pig variants

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Marvel Rivals received a patch earlier this week which made Hulk less hulky and paved the way for the launch of its first season. It also did something else: disabled the mods players had been using to add custom skins to the game.

 
Read more
articles.title: Marvel Rivals' latest update disabled mods, meaning you can no longer play as Skibidi Toilet or Vegeta

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
I'm terrified to go out, because last time I stepped outside the black ice on my road waggled my feet around threateningly at every step. I'm afraid I'll fall over, but weirdly I'm not so worried about, I dunno, hitting my head, as I am wanging my elbow and getting that jolt of fuzzy numbness all the way down my arm. At least if I hit my head I wouldn't be around to feel the aftermath.
For all you fellows who are equally afeared of the outside world, let's all agree to stay indoors and play some excellent games. Here's what we're all clicking on this weekend!
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Slavic Magic and Hooded Horse have released a new Manor Lords update, adding a couple of maps, the ability to construct bridges, and a bevy of smaller features to an already quite robust medieval city builder. 
 
Read more
articles.title: Hit city-builder Manor Lords has been updated with two new maps and a heap of changes

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If it seems like only last week that I was complaining there were too many gigantic space games, that's because it was only last week. Since then, I have written about Kerbal Space Program 2 and Space Engineers 2, because I am nothing if not a creature of contradictions. Now, here I am writing about Era One. In my defence, it's all your fault. Specifically, it's TheGreatOneSea's fault. They left a comment about Era One on our list of most-anticipated 2025 games, and reader, I Googled.
  
Read more
articles.title: Era One is an enveloping space RTS from Homeworld modders that lets you clip together your own Mothership

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 continues the misadventures of Henry of Skalitz, 15th century Bohemian blacksmith's son and chivalric Laddy Lad, who is questing to reclaim his murdered father's sword from some absolute shit of a noble. The prologue starts you off as the handsomely equipped and fully levelled-up bodyguard of Sir Hans Capon - an exasperating gadabout and your bosom chum from the 2018 game. You're on your way to deliver a message to a distant lord, in hopes that he'll take your own lord's side in the on-going civil war. But Plot intervenes in the shape of some suspiciously familiar bandits, who slaughter your retinue and reduce Henry and Sir Hans to a pair of shirtless runaways. 

 
Read more
articles.title: After five hours, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is a beautiful and blundering Boy's Day Out in Historyland

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
Factions. Here are the factions: the aggressive conquest Klingon guys. The evil insectoid hive mind who build stuff and/or have loads of cheap soldiers. The researchers who are probably robots and you usually pick because they can be competitive at anything. The diplomacy/espionage ones (humans, or The Greys).
You know what I'm talking about. You may well have thought of a recent exception too, since we've had a fair few 4Xeses experimenting with some of the standard formulae these last few years. It's been a while though since I read through every word of every faction's description and wanted to play all of them. Zephon captured my interest immediately.
Read more
articles.title: Rally Point: Zephon demonstrates that good 4X faction design is really characterisation

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
As a few of you might know, each Sunday at 4pm GMT I run Booked For The Week - a regular chat with a selection of cool industry folks about what they're reading, what they're hoping to read next, and what books they recommend. The very secret goal of the column is for the guests to name every book ever written. It's a task every single one has failed miserably at with two notable exceptions. One was Dan Griliopoulos, who listed 400 books in a document before he got bored and gave up - a heroic, if ultimately futile effort. The other was Warren Spector back in November, who not only gave me the longest and most detailed reply I'd had before or since, but also followed up several times to add more books to the list.
Read more
articles.title: Please help, Warren Spector keeps emailing me about books

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
"Oh, and one last thing..." teased the narration for yesterday's Like A Dragon Direct showcase on Like A Dragon: Pirate Yakuza In Hawaii, before announcing that the RPG will be getting New Game+ mode as part of a free post-launch update. It then cut to Majima and his crew making celebratory noises on deck. This follows last year's Infinite Wealth catching some backlash for the decision to lock the mode behind a £15/€15/$15 edition upgrade.
Unrelated, but I've decided to stop putting angry spiders through your letterbox every morning. I know, I know. Come on now. Hero is such a strong word.
Read more
articles.title: RGG ends Like A Dragon Direct by proudly announcing they won't charge for New Game+ this time, something most games don't do anyway

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
One or two lumps of annoyance in your morning coffee? Okay, here's one. You'll need to link to a PlayStation Network account to play The Last Of Us Part II on PC, say Sony. The requirement was reported by Video Games Chronicle, and sure enough, the Steam page for the "Remastered" version of the third-person fungus fighter includes a footnote in the game description that confirms it in plain language - "Account for PlayStation Network required". For a lot of people this is a minor nuisance, for others it more likely means that the game won't be on sale in your country at all. Sony's reasons for enforcing the requirement remain obscure. 
Read more
articles.title: The Last Of Us Part II will require a PSN account to play on PC, making it unplayable in over 100 countries

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Ubisoft are delaying Assassin's Creed Shadows again, but this time, not just out of concern about the quality of Assassin's Creed Shadows. The French publisher are pushing back release of the new samurai-era open worlder from 14th February to 20th March 2025 while they look into "various transformational strategic and capitalistic options to extract the best value for stakeholders", with news of a possible major "transaction" to follow. 
 Read more
articles.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows release delayed to March as Ubisoft's board consider a company sale

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The first time I died in Beyond Citadel, the game treated to me a close-up shot of my character's scantily clad, bisected body lying in a pool of guts and ripped underwear. It turns out you can turn off a lot of the gore and nudity. You can also swaddle yourself in some nice, sturdy, PG-13 body armor. But you're seemingly stuck with a certain base percentage of bulging, softcore gratuitousness in both the character portrait on bottom left, and in the mildly boobulent background art of the world. I'm not sure I can put up with all that, which is a shame, because Beyond Citadel is otherwise a promising, eerie FPS that mixes ideas from 90s shooters in pretty appealing ways.
 Read more
articles.title: Beyond Citadel is a fascinating, melancholy FPS, but you'll need a high tolerance for gore and titillation

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
"I sometimes joke about it, but it's like I need a war to start a new game," Rasheed Abu-Eideh tells me over a call. "The specific thing that made me make Liyla And The Shadows Of War is the attacks on Gaza in 2014, and the specific thing that made me make Dreams On A Pillow is the attacks on Gaza in 2023."
Dreams On A Pillow is a stealth adventure that tells the story of a young mother during the Nakba - the 1948 ethnic cleansing, displacement, and cultural suppression of Palestinian Arabs by Israel. As its funding campaign puts it, it’s a game about "a land full of people being made into a people without land."
Read more
articles.title: Dreams On A Pillow's developer on the challenges of making games from the West Bank

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
A long, long time ago I became obsessed with watching people play rally games beautifully. It was a blessing to see those disembodied hands sling virtual cars around with grace and precision, kicking up dirt in a way I could only dream of.
Now, though, I am going through a different phase. A less blessed phase. One where I watched the popular streamer and influencer Ludwig attempt to climb to Platinum rank in League Of Legends, all because he wanted to prove another popular streamer, who thought he couldn't do it, wrong. I know I've already put you off, so I don't blame you if you stop reading. Just know that I couldn't stop watching his streams, even as it conjured up terrible memories of a time spent doing the exact same thing at uni.
Read more
articles.title: I'm sad to announce I'm considering playing League Of Legends again

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
One for Obra Dinn and Golden Idol fans, this, although also for anyone who just loves a gorgeous map of an alien environment. Locator is a detective puzzler where you play an interstellar cartographer tasked with tracking down a missing archeologist named Abigail Lidari on an alien world. It takes inspiration from browser geography game Geoguessr. You’ll be studying sets of photos and comparing them with notes from Abigail’s journal, then pinpointing her location on a series of lovely maps.
Read more
articles.title: Geoguessr-inspired detective game Locator is about puzzles, perspective, and empathy on an alien planet

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Marvel Rivals Season 1 is about to begin, adding the Fantastic Four to the free-to-play hero shooter’s roster so that they can beat up Dracula, who has swamped the Earth in eternal night. It launches January 10th at 1 am PT / 4 am ET / 9 am GMT, and developers NetEase are paving the way in the traditional manner by rebalancing the character line-up so as to simultaneously win the adoration of certain player groups, while plunging others into apoplectic fury.
Do you like running rampage as Hela, goddess of death? Was that you who shot me full of crows on Klyntar last night? Well, how does 25 points off your base health suit you? Yeah, that’s what I thought. Screw you too.
 Read more
articles.title: Marvel Rivals patch makes Hulk less hulky, Hawkeye less shooty and the Goddess of Death deader, just in time for Season 1

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Over the Christmas break, I took a brief hiatus from reporting on every time a Total War developer breathes or spills tea on their shirt. The year ended, the world did not, and no Thanquol DLC was announced, but I did miss what I reckon is the strongest hint they’ve yet freely given that strategy game Total War: Warhammer 40,000 is both real and due an announcement very soon. Here’s the skinny.
Read more
articles.title: Future Creative Assembly games may "require blood thematically", which sure sounds like a Total War: Warhammer 40,000 teaser

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Someone deep in the bowels of the internet once betwittered that Dark Souls was "the My Summer Car of RPGs". The joke stuck with me enough to try the car mechanic sim when it was released into early access back in 2016. I didn't know it would take another nine years to bring this ambitiously hostile Finnish life simulator to a full release. But here it is. If you want a deeply confounding game about putting an old banger together piece by excruciating piece, while periodically sweating the grime off your body in a cramped sauna, then I can think of no better time waster. My Summer Car 1.0 came out yesterday, and a new trailer came with it.
Read more
articles.title: My Summer Car trundles out of early access with version 1.0 after nine years in the chop shop

articles.author: Robert Anderson
articles.description:
Dell has slashed prices on two configurations of its Alienware m16 R2 gaming laptop, offering significant value for those looking to upgrade their gaming setup. The model equipped with an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4060 GPU is now available for $1,299.99, while the RTX 4070 variant can be yours for $1,499.99.
 Read more
articles.title: You can save up to $400 Off Alienware m16 R2 gaming laptops today

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Gears Tactics and Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory developers Splash Damage have cancelled Transformers: Reactivate, the Hasbro action game they announced in 2022. They will also be "scaling down to refocus our efforts on other projects", and "a number of roles across the studio are now potentially at risk of redundancy".
 Read more
articles.title: Transformers: Reactivate, the Autobot action game from the Gears Tactics devs, has been cancelled

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
As someone who believes in the ideal of the trim, tidy PC interior, I do applaud the intent behind MSI’s Project Zero X. Currently on show at CES 2025, it’s a prototype desktop build that uses clever geometry and an unconventional motherboard I/O layout to hide practically every single wire in the joint, for a clean design that's housed for your viewing pleasure within a four-sided glass chamber. It’s the closest PCs have come to the simple Victorian pleasures of a nice terrarium, and honestly, good on it.
The problem is that if Project Zero X’s components ever actually go on sale, there becomes a non-zero percent chance that I will come into possession of that see-through case. And there is a one hundred percent chance I will ruin it.
Read more
articles.title: MSI’s panoramic PC case severely underestimates how bad at cable tidying I am

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
This is a quiet month for video game releases, as January tends to be, but there’s at least one approaching asteroid in the shape of Space Engineers 2. Announced over the winter, it’s a spruced-up reimagining of your scientifically determined 22nd favourite space game - the hectic Second Coming of a simulation we’ve devoted 14 whole-ass features to since 2013, including a seven-part diary series featuring many a starfaring Vengabus or Wild Wild Westerly giant robot spider.
It really is high time we gave the new game some attention, then. The very first alpha launches into Steam early access on January 27th. Here’s what’s in store.
 
Read more
articles.title: Space Engineers 2 launches this month and promises a refined and expanded starcrafting experience

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The more I tell you about Stimulation Clicker, the less funny it will be, so let's keep this brief. It's an idle clicker, obviously, which starts with a single button in the centre of a browser screen. The more "stimulation" you accrue through clicking, the more options become available. It escalates. And escalates. And escalates. I found that my feelings of delight grew roughly in proportion to the toll taken on my computer's processor. After 30 minutes, I was huffing and hooting like a drunken horse to a soundtrack of disintegrating laptop fans.
 Read more
articles.title: Stimulation Clicker is web 1.0 and web 3.0 having a fight inside one browser window

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Terrible news! Santa ignored all my letters asking for 2025 to be a year when no new videogames came out so I could catch up on everything I missed from the past several years. In fact, it seems like maybe someone else might have sent him a letter asking for there to be more big games coming than ever.
Read more
articles.title: Our 50 most anticipated PC games of 2025

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Last year’s annual CPU tug-of-war was cleanly won by AMD, its obscenely fast Ryzen 7 9800X3D almost singlehandedly leaving Intel and their Core Ultra chips in a heap of mud and P.E.-spec rope. Coming soon to press that advantage are the Ryzen 9 9950X3D and Ryzen 9 9900X3D, a pair of even higher-spec processors that headlined AMD’s plethora of CES 2025 hardware announcements.
No pricing (or exact release date) on these yet, but they both up the core and thread counts over the 9800X3D while peaking at higher boost clock speeds. And, of course, they share the same 3D V-Cache design that makes the 9800X3D such a superlative CPU in the first place. If you don’t know what this is and how it helps game performance, imagine how much faster you could eat Wotsits if you had a massive bucket of them on your desk at all times, instead of having to get up and walk to the kitchen to grab individual packs. In this case the Wotsits are data, the bucket is 3D V-Cache, and the hastened ruination of your digestive system is games running faster.
Read more
articles.title: AMD’s CES 2025 announcements include what will probably be yet another 'world’s fastest' CPU

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Yesterday, we reported that the US federal government had placed Chinese video game publisher Tencent - owner of League Of Legends developers Riot Games, Path Of Exile developers Grinding Gear and much more besides - on a list of Chinese military companies. The list in question is part of a strategy of counteracting what the US sees as the close relationship between China's armed forces and various civilian technology suppliers and research projects.
At the time of publication yesterday, a Tencent spokesperson had commented that the listing was based on a "misunderstanding". In a statement sent to RPS overnight and also published online, Tencent's chairman Ma Huateng and executive board have now said that they're prepared to get legal if the misunderstanding isn't resolved.
 Read more
articles.title: World's biggest game publisher Tencent threaten to sue US government for listing them as a Chinese military company

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
God-wrecking MOBA Smite 2 is going free-to-play next week after four months of paid early access. The game of omniscient deities scrapping over lanes and minions has been playable since September last year by early bird "founders" willing to pay some bucks (it had plenty of closed alphas since May too) but now it's finally opening up to the rest of us mere mortals. And it's throwing in a new "god" too, the genie-toting thief Aladdin. 
Read more
articles.title: Smite 2's Aladdin will trap players in a lamp with an angry genie as the MOBA becomes free-to-play

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
In a fairly exciting case of two major industry stories meeting in the middle, former members of downfallen indie publisher Annapurna Interactive have reportedly joined forces to take control of several game projects previously published by Take-Two Interactive's label Private Division, which has itself been sold off amid layoffs. The game projects in question include the Kerbal Space Program series and an unannounced project from Pokémon developer Game Freak.
 Read more
articles.title: Former Annapurna staff reportedly found new studio to rescue sold-off Private Division projects, including new Game Freak game

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Chinese publisher Tencent are the biggest video game company in the world. Their wholly owned subsidiaries including League Of Legends developers Riot Games, Path Of Exile developers Grinding Gear Games, and UK outfit Sumo Group. They own shares in everything from Epic Games through Ubisoft to Silent Hill 2 rebooters Bloober Team. Are you a game developer? Odds are that at least one percent of your body belongs to Tencent. Maybe one of your toes.
And now it turns out that Tencent are some kind of military operator, as well. Or at least, that's what the US Department of Defence would have us believe: they've just somewhat randomly added the firm to an infamous list of Chinese military companies, together with lithium-ion battery maker CATL. This potentially makes it difficult for Tencent to do business in the States, but Tencent say that it's all based on a "misunderstanding".
 Read more
articles.title: The US just added the world's biggest games publisher Tencent to their list of Chinese military companies

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
There’s a new Lenovo Legion Go on the way, and while it’s ditching the signature detachable controllers, it’s still got something unusual to stick on its CV. The Lenovo Legion Go S is a smaller, cheaper take on Lenovo’s portable gaming PC, and it’s on track to become the first officially licensed SteamOS handheld outside of Valve’s own Steam Deck range.
Read more
articles.title: Behold the Lenovo Legion Go S, the SteamOS handheld PC that isn’t a Steam Deck

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Bařina)
articles.description: GStreamer je multiplatformní framework založený na grafu filtrů, využívaný v přehrávačích jako Amarok či Banshee. S dynamickými pluginy a objekty GLib 2 umožňuje efektivní zpracování multimédií.
articles.title: Multimediální frameworky: GStreamer jako základ mnoha přehrávačů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Pravidelná sonda do světa software. Podíváme se na nástroj pro sledování a diagnostiku CAN komunikace, budeme testovat gRPC API rozhraní a nakonec si vyzkoušíme pomocníka pro správu IoT zařízení z CLI.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (22. 1. 2025): testování a diagnostika sběrnice CAN

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Na praktických příkladech si ověříme základní funkce poskytované matematickým koprocesorem Intel 8087, na který navazuje řada čipů 80287 a 80387. Posléze se tyto funkce staly přímo součástí hlavního mikroprocesoru.
articles.title: Matematické koprocesory na platformě 80×86 prakticky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CSIRT.CZ)
articles.description: Podíváme se na organizaci voice phishingového týmu, kritickou zranitelnost v SimpleHelp, na zero-day zranitelnost v produktech Ivanti VPN a na operace skupiny UAC-0063 spojované s GRU proti Kazachstánu.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: běžný den týmu telefonických podvodníků

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: KDE finišuje opravy pro Plasmu 6.3, GNOME a Flatpaku či digitální wellbeing, specifikace PCI Express 7.0 v0.7 dle harmonogramu, LibreOffice 25.2 RC2 jako možná poslední testovací verze, levnější grafika Intel Arc B570.
articles.title: Vydání Intel Arc B570, Wine 10.0 opravující Fallout 3

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Fedora hodlá cílit oficiální variantu s desktopem KDE Plasma jako systém pro multimédia a digitální obsah. Získají ve Fedoře současní tvůrci systém, který jim bude optimálně vyhovovat?
articles.title: Fedora KDE Plasma Edition jako systém pro tvůrce digitálního obsahu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Popíšeme si předávání hodnot mezi javascriptovým kódem na jedné straně a funkcemi a metodami naprogramovanými v jazyce Go na straně druhé. Kvůli odlišnému typovému systému obou jazyků se jedná o netriviální problém.
articles.title: Technologie WebAssembly a GopherJS: předávání argumentů mezi Go a JavaScriptem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Bařina)
articles.description: Multimediální frameworky představují klíčové nástroje pro zpracování a manipulaci s audiovizuálními daty. V tomto článku se nejprve seznámíme s jejich funkcemi a významem, poté se zaměříme na praktické využití FFmpeg.
articles.title: Multimediální frameworky: nízkoúrovňová sada nástrojů FFmpeg

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si vyzkoušíme aplikaci pro učení, podíváme se na sadu základních vývojářských nástrojů, přizpůsobíme si prostředí GNOME a vytvoříme si grafické vizualizaci souborů dat a funkcí.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (15. 1. 2025): naučte se učit a soustředit se

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Nedílnou součástí prakticky všech procesorů je modul pro operace s plovoucí řádovou čárkou. Na platformě IBM PC se jednalo o řadu matematických koprocesorů označovaných čísly 8087, 80287, 80387 a (nepřesně) 80487.
articles.title: Matematické koprocesory na 80×86 pro výpočty s plovoucí řádovou čárkou

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Před necelými třemi lety ohlásili vývojáři AMD v rámci projektu GPUOpen knihovnu Orochi pro run-time přepínání mezi API CUDA a HIP. Nyní přichází již třetí verze, který opět vylepšuje běh.
articles.title: AMD Orochi 3.0 pro přepínání mezi HIP a CUDA za běhu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nadace FreeBSD (The FreeBSD Foundation) už dostává financování pro vývojáře pracující na zero-trust builds / reproducible builds. Pokud půjde vše hladce, novinka by se mohla objevit už v rámci budoucího vydání FreeBSD 15.0. Jde o dotaci od německého Sovereign Tech Fund ve výši téměř 700 tisíc eur, která byla ohlášena loni v létě).
articles.title: FreeBSD 15.0 směřuje k reprodukovatelným sestavením, německá dotace už proudí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze multimediálního balíku SDL 3.2.0 je prvním vydáním v rámci nové řady SDL3. Novinky jsou tak významnějšího charakteru, tvůrci zde přinášejí vylepšení v řadě oblastí. Trojková řada tak přináší podporu kamerek přes PipeWire (obecně SDL3 preferuje PipeWire před PulseAudio), vylepšenou podporu běhu na Waylandu, renderer pro API Vulkan, počáteční podporu barevných prostorů pro budoucí implementaci HDR či zahození starého kódu a naopak mnohá nová API.
articles.title: Nová verze SDL 3.2 přináší nová API, lepší podporu HiDPI či vylepšený zvuk

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Linuxových systémů přibývá, každý den se spouštějí nové servery a někdo se o ně musí starat. To znamená spoustu různých dovedností specifických právě pro linuxové prostředí. Jak to zprovoznit, kudy bezpečně dovnitř, co tam najdeme, jak se o to postaráme a jak to nastavíme nebo rozšíříme.
articles.title: Naučte se používat Linux správně a bezpečně (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývoj Wine řady 10 je u konce, tvůrci vydali verzi 10.0 a projekt tak završuje dlouhý proces přechodu Wine na novější generaci. Novinek je opravdu obří množství, zmiňme jich několik. Wine 10, které bude i základem příští verze Steam Protonu, tak například jen u ARMu přidává podporu ARM64EC, hybridních modulů ARM64X či rozhraní pro emulaci 64bit x86.
articles.title: Wine 10.0 je tu, přináší víc než 6 tisíc změn včetně vylepšení podpory ARM64

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Novinky, které projekt souborového systému bcachefs prodělal v poněkud delší poslední době, jsou v tuto chvíli začleňovány bez komplikací. Aféra kolem vývojáře Kenta Overstreeta, kterému bylo znemožněno zasílat změny projektu do verze jádra Linux 6.13 kvůli nevhodnému vyjadřování na adresu jiných lidí, je doufejme u konce.
articles.title: Bcachefs versus budoucí jádro Linux 6.14: zatím žádné drama, navíc kód masivně zrychluje

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Velice blízko uvedení na trh se nachází příští generace Radeonů od AMD, známá jako RDNA4 (případně GFX12). Do projektu Mesa, konkrétně ovladače RADV, který Radeony používají pro API Vulkan, míří jejich podpora, která se obejví v rámci Mesa 25.0.
articles.title: Radeon Vulkan ovladač RADV se připravuje na RDNA4 generaci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Americká automobilka GM prodávala data řidičů firmám LexisNexis a Verisk. Šlo například o přesnou polohu auta s četností až každé tři sekundy, co řidič poslouchá v rádiu, jestli prudce brzdí nebo zrychluje, jestli překračuje rychlostní limit, jestli používá bezpečnostní pásy a jestli řídí pozdě v noci.
articles.title: GM má zakázáno pět let prodávat data řidičů, ta byla použita k zvýšení pojistného

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Klient elektronické pošty Outlook v produktech Microsoft 365, Outlook 2021, Outlook 2019 a Outlook 2016 byl 7. ledna aktualizován na verzi  2412 (build 18324.20168). Tato verze padá při psaní emailů s chybou 0×c0000005.
articles.title: Microsoft Outlook padá při psaní emailů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Terraform vám umožní spravovat infrastrukturu jako kód, to znamená verzovanou v Gitu, přidávání zdrojů pomocí merge (pull) requestů a mnoho dalších výhod. Ukážeme si, jak Terraform pracuje, jak jej používat v týmu a jak jím spravovat infrastrukturu.
articles.title: Terraform: spravujte infrastrukturu jako kód (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: PID (process ID) byl historicky omezen na 65 536 (216). Od systemd 243 z roku 2019 je omezení 4 194 304 (222), což snižuje pravděpodobnost kolizí. To však rozbíjí některý starý software, který očekává PID
articles.title: Jádro 6.14 umožní nastavit pid_max kvůli starému software

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Linus Torvalds vydal očekávané jádro 6.13. Minulý týden se nestalo nic hrozného ani neočekávaného, takže jsem označil a vydal finální verzi 6.13, okomentoval vydání.
articles.title: Linuxové jádro 6.13 odstraňuje ReiserFS a rozšiřuje podporu zařízení od Apple

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na Steamu je možné zdarma získat hru Mini Thief. Ve hře s retro pixelovou grafikou jste zloděj a vykrádáte domy. Přitom se snažíte, aby vás nechytili.
articles.title: Hra zdarma na Steamu Mini Thief

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Rakouský NOYB (None of Your Business) si stěžuje na šest čínských firem TikTok, AliExpress, SHEIN, Temu, WeChat a Xiaomi kvůli porušování GDPR. Oficiální stížnost byla podána v Řecku, Itálii, Belgii, Nizozemsku a Rakousku.
articles.title: NOYB si stěžuje na TikTok, AliExpress, SHEIN, Temu, WeChat a Xiaomi kvůli porušování GDPR

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Fedora používá v bootovatelných obrazech SquashFS. To by se však mohlo změnit. Pro Fedoru 42 bylo navrhnuto používat EROFS (Enhanced Read-Only FileSystem), který je v jádře od roku 2019 a byl vyvinut firmou Huawei.
articles.title: Fedora 42 bude mít EROFS v bootovatelných obrazech

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Tony)
articles.description: Společnost SUSE vůbec poprvé přichází s nabídkou placených stáží pro studenty a studentky, kteří chtějí přispět k vývoji open-source řešení na bázi GNU/Linuxu (SUSE Linux Enterprise) a Kubernetes (SUSE Rancher).
articles.title: SUSE nově nabízí placené stáže pro studenty českých univerzit

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Linus Torvalds se v oznámení jádra 6.13-rc7 přiznal ke svým koníčkům. Rád stavěl LEGO, ale v poslední době si oblíbil stavebnice elektronických kytarových pedálů. Sám ale na kytaru nehraje a svým kamarádům již vyrobené pedály daroval.
articles.title: Linus Torvalds staví kytarové pedály

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Kubernetes je dnes nejrozšířenější platformou na hostovaní Docker kontejnerů a je podporován velkými hráči na trhu (Google, Amazon, Microsoft) skrz Cloud Native Computing Foundation. Kuberneres pro provoz používají všechny velikosti firem, od startupu po korporace. Pojďme se naučit jej používat na dvoudenním kurzu Úvod do Kubernetes, který proběhne v naší pražské školicí místnosti ve dnech 27. a 28. ledna. Školení proběhne pouze online.
articles.title: Naučte se Kubernetes na našem dvoudenním školení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: svatas)
articles.description: Společnost Nintendo včera zveřejnila oficiální video odhalující podobu a existenci druhé verze populární konzole Switch. Zároveň se objevila i krátká zpráva. Moc konkrétních faktů ale zatím neznáme. V samotném videu je zmiňováno datum 2. dubna 2025, kdy dojde k oficiální tiskové konferenci. Také datum vydání není jasné, hovoří se o roku 2025.
articles.title: Nintendo Switch 2 byl oficiálně odhalen

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Certifikační autorita Let's Encrypt chce letos začít nabízet volitelně krátkodobé certifikáty s šestidenní platností. Už kvůli tomu testuje rozšíření protokolu ACME, díky kterému bude možné volit různé varianty certifikátů pomocí takzvaných profilů. Během února by měl být vystaven první krátkodobý certifikát pro interní potřeby autority, zhruba v dubnu pak budou tyto certifikáty nabídnuty úzké skupině testerů a ke konci roku se pak novinka zpřístupní všem.
articles.title: Let's Encrypt bude vystavovat certifikáty na IP adresy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Tradiční konference InstallFest se letos v březnu opět uskuteční, zapište si do kalendáře víkend 15. a 16. března. Na akci se setkávají začátečníci s ostřílenými linuxáky, kteří jim pomáhají s nejrůznějšími problémy, které vyžadují více zkušeností. Setkání proběhne opět na FEL ČVUT na Karlově náměstí v Praze.
articles.title: InstallFest proběhne 15. a 16. března, přihlaste svou přednášku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Byla vydána knihovna Libvirt verze 11.0. Mezi významné změny v této verzi patří možnost exportovat souborové systémy VirtIOFS v režimu pouze pro čtení, přidání podpory pro tagování VLAN a sdružování síťových rozhraní pomocí ovladačů network, QEMU a LXC.
articles.title: Libvirt 11.0 přináší VirtIOFS pouze pro čtení a podporu VLAN

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Doom a Tetris jsme už viděli běžet na mnoha různých zařízeních a v mnoha prostředích. Thomas Rinsma využil bohatých možností nabízených formátem PDF a vytvořil Doom a Tetris v dokumentu PDF. Na svém blogu pak popisuje, jak celá věc s dynamickým PDF funguje.
articles.title: Doom a Tetris naprogramované v PDF

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vyšel Linux Mint verze 22.1 s kódovým označením Xia. Jde o vydání s dlouhodobou podporou (LTS), která poběží až do roku 2029. Mezi významné změny v tomto vydání patří přechod na Aptkit a Captain, což jsou moderní nástroje pro správu balíčků. Cílem bylo vyčistit zastaralé součásti systému a vytvořit zjednodušenou sadu nástrojů a knihoven pro správu balíčků.
articles.title: Linux Mint 22.1 přináší Cinnamon 6.4 a jednotnější uživatelské prostředí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Neznámý uživatel vystupující pod přezdívkou Belsen Group zveřejnil konfigurační soubory a hesla k VPN pro zařízení FortiGate společnosti Fortinet na populárním fóru o kybernetické kriminalitě. Data obsahují IP adresy, konfigurace a hesla k více než 15 000 zařízení po celém světě.
articles.title: Uniklo přes 15 000 přihlašovacích údajů k prvkům Fortinet FortiGate

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Výzvy spojené s nařízením DORA. České nemocnice nemají dostatečně zajištěnou kyberbezpečnost. USA omezí vývoz čipů v oblasti AI, dotkne se to i Česka. Letos lze čekat nás rozvoj AI agentů, AI PC i změny v datových centrech. Serverová virtualizace od Huawei podle DCS.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: USA omezí vývoz čipů v oblasti AI, dotkne se to i Česka

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 3/2025

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Top 10 ve fyzice za rok 2024: Laserové chlazení pozitronia. AI jazykové modely mohou efektivně vytvářet konzistentní příběhy. Studium fotonů umožnilo navrhnout novou metodu detekce axionů.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Relativistický elektronový paprsek by mohl dostat sondu k Alfa Centauri za 40 let

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled prosincových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za prosinec 2024

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Zde máte vše, co je od Goodoffer24 dostupné, abyste dostali nejen levný klíč na nový operační systém Windows 11 Pro nebo Windows 10 Home Pro with CDKey, nebo kancelářský balík Office 2019 za tu nejlepší cenu v originální, legitimní verzi a ušetřili peníze v porovnání s normální prodejní cenou.
articles.title: Nový rok 2025 s nabídkou softwaru – Windows 11 jen za €20 od Goodoffer24

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Acer rozšiřuje své portfolio Copilot+ PC o nové notebooky Swift Go s umělou inteligencí. HP představuje novinky s umělou inteligencí, které zvyšují produktivitu. Synology globálně spouští ActiveProtect: zjednodušená ochrana podnikových dat. Dell zjednoduší své portfolio počítačů a laptopů. Svět hrozeb: Deepfake, zneužití umělé inteligence, ale i útoky na kritickou infrastrukturu. DiskStation Manager a pevné disky Synology. Fortinet zvyšuje zabezpečení a výkon webových aplikací.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Orbitronika – spintronika má konkurenci. Nový metamateriál exponenciálně zesiluje zvukové vibrace. Webbův dalekohled objevil zatím nejmenší planetku z hlavního pásu.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: O životě na bázi umělé inteligence

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Malé modely AI mají být velkým trendem. Infrastruktura pro rok 2025: Gartner předpovídá devirtualizaci a distribuovaná úložiště. Předvedli kvantovou teleportaci v infrastruktuře běžného internetového provozu. Nový zákon o kybernetické bezpečnosti může dopadnout i na firmy s méně než 10 zaměstnanci.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Umělá inteligence o3 dosáhla úspěchu v testu obecné inteligence. Nově vyvinuté materiály jsou prakticky bez tření i v makroměřítku. Olomoucký grafenový materiál míří na trh díky spin-out společnosti. Studie fotonů odhalila, že při jejich srážce se mohou objevit víry – a jak to souvisí s kvantovými počítači?
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: U některých AI chatbotů byly zaznamenány příznaky připomínající demenci

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Multiplatformní multimediální knihovna SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer) byla oficiálně vydána v nové major verzi 3 (3.2.0). Změny jsou popsány v README pro migraci aplikací z SDL 2 na SDL 3.
articles.title: SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer) 3 (3.2.0)

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Wine bylo po roce vývoje od vydání verze 9.0 vydáno v nové stabilní  verzi 10.0. Přehled novinek na GitLabu. Vypíchnuta je nová architektura ARM64EC a podpora High DPI škálování.

articles.title: Deduplidog – promažte s lehkostí

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost DeepSeek představila (𝕏) AI model DeepSeek-R1 (Hugging Face) srovnatelný s OpenAI o1 a uvolnila jej pod open source licencí MIT, tj. zdarma i pro komerční použití.
articles.title: Open source AI model DeepSeek-R1

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: GKrellM (GNU Krell Monitors, Wikipedie), tj. grafická aplikace pro sledování systémů a různých událostí, byla po pěti a půl letech vydána v nové verzi 2.4.0. Přehled novinek na Gitea.
articles.title: GKrellM 2.4.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Americká první dáma Melania Trumpová vydala v předvečer manželovy inaugurace vlastní kryptoměnu. Jmenuje se $Melania. Donald Trump vydal vlastní kryptoměnu $Trump den před manželkou.
articles.title: Melania a Donald Trumpovi vydali své kryptoměny

articles.description: GNU Project Debugger aneb GDB byl vydán ve verzi 16.1. Podrobný přehled novinek v souboru NEWS.

articles.description: Po 9 týdnech vývoje od vydání Linuxu 6.12 oznámil Linus Torvalds vydání Linuxu 6.13. Přehled novinek a vylepšení na LWN.net: první a druhá polovina začleňovacího okna a Linux Kernel Newbies. Odstraněn byl souborový systém ReiserFS.

articles.author: Fluttershy, yay!
articles.description: 19. ledna 2038 přeteče hodnota time_t na 32bitových systémech, na vyřešení problému roku 2038 (Y2K38) tedy zbývá 13 let. Např. Debian v uplynulém roce přešel na 64bitový čas. Bernhard Wiedemann z openSUSE sdílí chyby v sestavení rozšířeného softwaru.
articles.title: Problém roku 2038: zbývá 13 let

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána druhá opravná verze 21.2 v dubnu loňského roku vydané verze 21 multimediálního centra Kodi (dříve XBMC, Wikipedie) s kódovým označením Omega.
articles.title: Kodi 21.2 "Omega"

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Linux kernel developers are working to make it easier to debug early boot issues such as Kexec failures as currently dealing with such situations can be a frustrating and time consuming headache for figuring out the problems prior to the kernel being fully brought online...
articles.title: Linux 6.14 Working To Make It Less Painful Debugging Early Boot Issues

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back in April 2022 was the announcement by AMD's GPUOpen team of Orochi as a library for HIP/CUDA API run-time switching. Making use of Orochi allows for dynamically targeting either AMD HIP or NVIDIA CUDA at run-time to ease the distribution/usage of apps wanting to target both AMD and NVIDIA GPUs from the same software build. Today Orochi 3.0 was released...
articles.title: AMD Releases Orochi 3.0 For HIP & CUDA API Switching At Run-Time

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Merged this week into the LLVM compiler codebase is initial support for "arch15" within the SystemZ back-end. Arch15 likely correlates to the IBM z17 mainframes with Telum II processors...
articles.title: LLVM Lands Initial Support For IBM SystemZ "arch15" Target: IBM z17 / Telum II

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Important code restructuring to the Intel Trust Domain Extensions (TDX) code is landing for the Linux 6.14 kernel to make it more robust moving forward and preparing for future features around this confidential computing / trusted execution environment (TEE) functionality built into the newest Xeon processors...
articles.title: Important Changes To Intel TDX Coming With Linux 6.14

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The second of three planned betas for the Qt 6.9 cross-platform UI toolkit is now available for testing ahead of the planned stable release in March...
articles.title: Qt 6.9 Toolkit Beta 2 Now Available For Testing

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The FreeBSD Foundation has begun receiving funding to work on zero-trust builds / reproducible builds. The work will hopefully be wrapped up in time for the major FreeBSD 15.0 release...
articles.title: FreeBSD 15.0 Aims For Reproducible Builds / Zero-Trust Builds With Fresh Funding

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: In addition to the Wine 10.0 stable release today, making the day very exciting as well for Linux gamers is the first official SDL 3.0 release!..
articles.title: SDL 3 Officially Released With New APIs, Better HiDPI & Improved Audio Handling

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: In addition to the Bcachefs changes for the Linux 6.14 kernel, the Btrfs file-system feature updates have also been submitted and merged for this next version of the Linux kernel...
articles.title: Btrfs Changes Land In Linux 6.14 With New RAID1 Round-Robin Option

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: On the first day of the Linux 6.14 merge window there were a number of new AMD CPU features submitted. That's continued today with so far having the new "amd_node" driver to talk about for splitting up the modern Zen-era code and more of the legacy AMD Northbridge code from the pre-Zen days...
articles.title: New "AMD Node" Driver Introduced In Linux 6.14 For Splitting Up Legacy Northbridge Code

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As was expected this week, Wine 10.0 stable is now available as the newest annual feature release to this open-source software that allows running Windows games and applications on Linux and other platforms. Wine also serves as the basis for Valve's Steam Play (Proton) and CodeWeavers' CrossOver software...
articles.title: Wine 10.0 Released With Native Wayland Support, Better HiDPI

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Along with recently announcing the Raspberry Pi 500 keyboard computer and the Raspberry Pi 5 16GB (review still forthcoming; the 16GB model only arrived last week), the Raspberry Pi Monitor debuted last month as their first foray into displays. For $100 USD you get a 15.6-inch 1080p display that is simple but pairs well with the Raspberry Pi 400/500 or just the single board computer or any other HDMI-connected device for that matter.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi Monitor Pairs Great With The Raspberry Pi 500 As A $100 Display

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Serpent OS as the modern, from-scratch Linux distribution being led by well known open-source developer Ikey Doherty has started on a new project: disks-rs. The disks-rs project is intended to deal with file-systems, installation / partitioning, and block device management in a safe and effective manner from the Rust programming language...
articles.title: Serpent OS Developing disks-rs To Safely Deal With File-Systems & Block Devices In Rust

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Adding to the plethora of new hardware support coming with the Linux 6.14 kernel is enabling upstream support for the FPGAs found on the Intel-powered AAEON UP single board computers that are targeted for makers, hobbyists, and various industrial uses...
articles.title: Linux 6.14 Landing Support For FPGA Support On AAEON UP Maker Boards

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The big networking subsystem feature pull was sent out this morning for the Linux 6.14 merge window...
articles.title: Linux 6.14 Networking Brings Many Wired & Wireless Driver Improvements

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Over the past week there has been an uptick in patches pertaining to RDNA4's GFX12 graphics engine within the open-source Radeon Vulkan driver "RADV" for Mesa 25.0 to benefit Linux systems...
articles.title: Open-Source Radeon Vulkan Driver "RADV" Seeing More RDNA4 Work In Recent Days

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel's upstreaming work around the next-gen Core Ultra "Panther Lake" processors continues for the Linux kernel. Among other code being prepped for submitting during the Linux 6.14 merge window, on Monday the thermal driver updates were focused on enabling support for Intel Panther Lake processors...
articles.title: Linux 6.14 Thermal Drivers Get Ready For Intel Panther Lake

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: In addition to merging a number of the pull requests yesterday for the start of the Linux 6.14 cycle, Linux creator Linus Torvalds did merge some of his own new code as well. While his time these days working on new kernel code itself is more limited with managing the ever-growing upstream kernel community, he has managed some notable items in recent times like addressing ARM64 kernel annoyances and some performance optimizations...
articles.title: Linus Torvalds Adapts Linux User Address Masking To Use CMOV

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The x86/cache updates for the in-development Linux 6.14 kernel are extending the Resource Control "resctrl" code for Intel Resource Director Technology /  AMD Platform Quality of Service to have the capability of total memory bandwidth monitoring...
articles.title: Linux 6.14 Resource Control To Allow Total Memory Bandwidth Monitoring

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As a follow-up to yesterday's article around the on-disk format changes and other feature work on Bcachefs for Linux 6.14, the changes ended up being merged without issue for this next kernel version. That came after the Bcachefs changes were rejected during the Linux 6.13 cycle due to a Code of Conduct (CoC) committee decision...
articles.title: Bcachefs Changes Merged Without Issue For The Linux 6.14 Kernel

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: On this first day of the Linux 6.14 merge window to kick off the new kernel development cycle there are a few pull requests around new AMD CPU features worth noting...
articles.title: New AMD CPU Features Enabled For The Start Of The Linux 6.14 Kernel Cycle

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Building off yesterday's release of the Linux 6.13 kernel, GNU Linux-libre 6.13 is out today as this downstream kernel from FSF LA that strips out code pertaining to the ability to load non-free drivers/microcode and other elements not deemed within the standards of the Free Software Foundation, even when it means removing/disabling hardware support and features...

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: An engineer from AMD by way of their Nod.ai acquisition is seeking feedback from the community around what other Radeon graphics cards you would like to see supported by the ROCm support on Linux. This community wishlist extends to ROCm Windows support as well but at least there the HIP Rutime/SDK on Windows already supports more consumer GPUs than Linux...
articles.title: AMD Seeking Feedback Around What Radeon GPUs You Would Like Supported By ROCm

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: After six release candidates going back to early December, it looks like Wine 10.0 stable will be ready to ship this week. This is largely as expected with the annual Wine stable releases tending to come around mid-to-late January. Here's a look at what's ahead for this stable release for enjoying Windows games and applications under Linux and other platforms...
articles.title: Wine 10.0 Expected This Week For Improving Windows Software On Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following the Bcachefs pull requests being rejected during the Linux 6.13 cycle by the kernel's Code of Conduct committee, the Linux 6.14 kernel cycle is kicking off with a big pull request so that the upstream kernel can get back into sync with the latest development code for this cycle. This pull also contains the last anticipated major on-disk format upgrade prior to the removal of the "experimental" flag for this copy-on-write file-system...
articles.title: Bcachefs Sends In "The Last Big On Disk Format Upgrade" For Linux 6.14

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Open-source developers are working on allowing the Mesa RADV Vulkan driver to support the "Cyan Skillfish" graphics processor IP found within the Sony PlayStation 5 APU as well as the AMD BC-250 mining cards...
articles.title: RADV Vulkan Driver Support Being Worked On For The GPU Found In The Sony PS5 & BC-250

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Earlier this month at CES was the announcement of the GeForce RTX 50 "Blackwell" series. Among the first of these consumer Blackwell GPUs is the GeForce RTX 5090 flagship graphics card that is set to retail for $1999 USD. The NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5090 Founder's Edition graphics card arrived at Phoronix a few days ago to begin Linux testing.
articles.title: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5090 Arrives For Linux Testing

articles.author: Michael Larabel

articles.title: Linux 6.14 To Allow VirtualBox Guest Support On ARM64 VMs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: For the Linux 6.13 cycle the Rust code was hitting a "tipping point" with more Rust kernel drivers expected soon. For Linux 6.14 there is indeed a lot more Rust code being primed for this next kernel version...
articles.title: More Rust Code Is Coming For Linux 6.14 Along With Hitting Another "Major Milestone"

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel software engineers overnight published their new quarterly release of the Intel FFmpeg Cartwheel, the collection of the company's patches against this open-source multimedia library for enhancing the Intel GPU acceleration support while the patches work their way for upstream FFmpeg...
articles.title: Intel FFmpeg Cartwheel 2024Q4 Adds Battlemage GPU Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Ingo Molnar sent out the big batch of scheduler enhancements bright and early today for helping kick off the start of the Linux 6.14 merge window...
articles.title: Many Scheduler Improvements Ready To Better Enhance The Linux 6.14 Kernel

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The "TURNIP" open-source Vulkan API driver within Mesa for supporting Qualcomm Adreno graphics is now able to expose accelerated ray query support for ray-tracing with newer Adreno GPUs...
articles.title: Open-Source Qualcomm Adreno Vulkan Driver Lands Ray Query Support

articles.description: Among the VFS pull requests sent out this weekend in advance of the Linux 6.14 merge window formally opening were the VFS direct I/O (DIO) updates that introduce a new STATX_DIO_READ_ALIGN field for addressing a possible performance pitfall...

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
The new Diablo 4 Season 7, Season of Witchcraft, adds an all-new seasonal questline as well as a plethora of Witchcraft-themed powers you can acquire. In order to access the new content and powers, you first need to Ally with the Coven by seeking out the new Coven NPC Gelena in Diablo 4.





Where to find Gelena in Diablo 4


At the start of Diablo 4 Season 7 you can find Gelena in the town of Geakul located on the western side of the map in the region of Kehjistan. This is actually the port that you visit at the beginning of the Vessel of the Hatred expansion that takes you to the new region of Nahantu.


Gelena can be found by the docks of Geakul, close to the Waypoint for the area. Upon teleporting to the Waypoint, simply look to your left and you should find Geakul standing there wait…
articles.title: How to complete Ally with the Coven and find Gelena in Diablo 4

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The Lunar New Year event 2025 will go live in Adopt Me on January 24, and you can add a few reptilian friends to your collection.


While the event is live, you can collect up to four snakes as your new pets. Thankfully, we already have information about how to get them inside the game, which will help you to be on top when the event goes live soon.


How to get the Adopt Me Lunary New Year Event 2025 Snakes


There will be four snakes, one of which will be of Legendary rarity. Apart from that, you'll be able to obtain a new snake every week, and you can get all four by the time the event ends. You'll have to get an event currency called Shooting Stars to find a snake.


Based on YouTube Cookie Cutter, we can get Shooting Stars daily. They can be collected from the ground, and you can use them in the Lunar Vending Machine. You can always get more Shooting Stars with the help of microtransactions if you don't mind spending on Robux. I believe there will be more items in the Vending Machine, and getting a snake will boil down to your luck (this is my assumption, not verified information). 


Thanks to Cookie Cutter, we know that the first two snakes will be called Gilded Snake and Blossom Snake. Make sure to check out this weekly dev blog from Jessie to learn more about how to get all the snakes during the upcoming event.




It will be interesting to learn more about the events' other parts. We will update any additional farming methods for Shooting Stars if they exist during the event. Additionally, it will be interesting to get more details about the Legendary snake and how to obtain it in Adopt Me.


The Lunar New Year event will be available for four weeks, starting from January 24. While the three snakes will each be available for a week, the Legendary snake will be available during all four weeks. Make sure to get all of them before the event ends in February. 

The post Adopt Me: How to get all snakes in Lunar New Year event 2025 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Adopt Me: How to get all snakes in Lunar New Year event 2025

articles.description:
The Defense Tech event is now live in Toilet Tower Defense, and it's a fun way of obtaining various rewards by solving a puzzle.


In this case, you'll need to find the locations of nine circuits, which will complete the collection and unlock the rewards. Without further delay, let's take a look at how you can find all the circuits in the Defense Tech event.


How to find the Circuits in Toilet Tower Defense Tech event


All nine Circuit boards are located around the Tech City event world. Thankfully, they're pretty easy to spot despite them having different locations. You'll be looking for bright green boards at various spots. Of course, you might have encountered some of them as they're not exactly hidden. If you're yet to complete the collection, here are the locations of all nine boards.



The first three boards are located inside the play area. The first of the three is at the enemy spawn portal, while the second will be at the center of the arena. The third one is slightly hidden behind a rock formation.


The fourth one is right behind the portal, which lets you access the Toilet Fortress.


The fifth one can be found behind the Ranked mode board, near the Apocalypse city map.


To get the sixth board, go to the Summon Unit area. You'll find the board next to a wooden block.


The seventh one can be collected from the Trading Plaza. Go to the archway on the left, and you'll find the board next to a pillar.


The eighth one is also located at the Trading Plaza, adjacent to a wooden statue at the far end of the location.


The final one will require you to visit a statue in the water at Trading Plaza. The Circuit board will be located at the top of the statue.





Collecting all nine Circuit boards in the Defense Tech event will help you get 1,000 XP and 500 Batteries.

The post Toilet Tower Defense: All 9 Defense Tech circuit locations appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Toilet Tower Defense: All 9 Defense Tech circuit locations

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Judero developers Talha and Jack Co have announced that the Kickstarter (not live yet) for Mashina will start tomorrow, January 22, 2025. Along with the announcement is a new trailer, as well as the estimated release date of June, 2025.


The Kickstarter is intended to raise funds to finish the last stretch of development, as it seems Mashina is well on the way, judging by the trailer. The campaign is aiming to raise £12000. The game was announced with a teaser this past December, but the Kickstarter and gameplay trailer paint a much clearer picture.




You play as the titular character who has a penchant for digging. They’re stranded on an island with a handful of locals that you’ll get intimately familiar with. Digging allows you to gather resources, as well as things to decorate the island and gift to the other characters. Beyond just directly getting your hands dirty, you can also construct machines to help with your work. Looks cozy.


Like Judero, all of the assets in Machina are hand-sculpted. Apparently, if you pledge £500, you’ll get one of the handmade robots. I had the chance to interview one of the developers, Jack King-Spooner, for the Destructoid Changelog Newsletter’s monthly special this month. He tells me that clay getting stuck under fingernails. As to what his strategy is. “To prevent under-nail clay I use a collection of ornate porcelain thimbles.” Incredible. I only ask the tough questions.


I also reviewed Judero back in September. It’s fantastic. I don’t exactly get it, but I can dig those vibes. There’s nothing out there quite like it, and it’s something you have to experience. I think I can grok Mashina a little better, barring any massive curveballs that might be thrown.


The Kickstarter for Mashina starts tomorrow, January 22, 2025. It’s release is planned for PC sometimes in June 2025.

The post Judero developer’s handcrafted follow-up, Mashina, digs into Kickstarter tomorrow appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Judero developer’s handcrafted follow-up, Mashina, digs into Kickstarter tomorrow

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
Anime Vanguards 3.0 update went live earlier during the weekend, and it has introduced something called Gift Boxes and Presents.


These items can be obtained by grinding missions inside the game. However, you can take steps to increase your chances of success and the rate you get the Gift Boxes in Anime Vanguards.


How to get Gift Boxes and Presents in Anime Vanguards


To begin the process, you'll want to open a Winter Portal (can be purchased with Gems). While you can earn Gift Boxes from different ones, go for the ones that take place on Planet Namak. This is the easiest way to obtain Presents, and dealing with the enemies will be easier. This is applicable irrespective of the tier of your stage.


The next step is to complete the Winter Portal, which will guarantee another portal (if you successfully manage to clear it). These portals begin from Tier 1 and go all the way up to Tier 10. If you clear a Tier 10 Portal, you'll only get a Tier 9/Tier 10 Portal in return. Hence, the event gets better the more you play the game.


Exclusive units are also recommended, as they have better in-game stats and abilities, making it easier for you to end the enemies. This is more important if you're trying to clear the high-tier portals.


Do note that a Gift Box isn't guaranteed even if you manage to complete a portal. 


Screenshot by Destructoid


How to use Presents in Anime Vanguards


There are two main ways to use Presents that you get. The Presents are a separate currency used at the Event NPC to get different items (located in the Quest area). However, a better use for this currency is to use it on the Winter Event limited banner. Some fantastic characters are present on this banner, and the only way to open this is by using the Gift Boxes.


Hence, it's the best time to get grinding in Anime Vanguards and earn as many Gift Boxes and Presents as possible.

The post What do Gift Boxes and Presents do and how to get them in Anime Vanguards appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: What do Gift Boxes and Presents do and how to get them in Anime Vanguards
